original_title: Stronger demand for Sri Lanka 6-month bills at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields edged lower with the debt office selling 156.93 billion rupees of bills after offering, 172 billion rupees.
The debt office sold 75 billion rupees of 3-month bills at 14.57 percent, down 02 basis points after offering 60 billion rupees.
73.2 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 14.54 percent, down 05 basis points after offering 57.5 billion rupees.
Only 7.7 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 12.93 percent up 10 basis points after offering 55 billion rupees.
There were 128 billion rupees of bids for 3-month bills, 142 billion rupees of bids for 6-month bills and only 59.2 billion rupees of bids for 12-month bills.

There is stronger demand for 6-month bills at current prices and lower demand for longer term securities amid political uncertainty over upcoming elections, and concerns over continuity of reforms, market participants said. (Colombo/Dec20/2023)
